title: Buffalo Creek (Elk River tributary, Oklahoma)
text:
Buffalo Creek is a <a href="stream">stream</a> in <a href="McDonald%20County%2C%20Missouri">McDonald</a> and 
<a href="Newton%20County%2C%20Missouri">Newton</a> counties in <a href="Missouri">Missouri</a> and <a href="Delaware%20County%2C%20Oklahoma">Delaware County</a>, <a href="Oklahoma">Oklahoma</a>. It is a tributary of the <a href="Elk%20River%20%28Oklahoma%29">Elk River</a>.
The stream <a href="headwaters">headwaters</a> arise in Newton County south of <a href="Neosho%2C%20Missouri">Neosho</a> near the campus of <a href="Crowder%20College">Crowder College</a> at and it flows west passing under <a href="US%20Route%2071">US Route 71</a> and then southwest into McDonald County passing the community of <a href="May%2C%20Missouri">May</a>. It continues to the southwest passing under <a href="Missouri%20Route%2043">Missouri routes 43 and 76</a> and the community of <a href="Tiff%20City%2C%20Missouri">Tiff City</a> and into Oklahoma. It reaches its <a href="confluence">confluence</a> with the Elk about two miles southwest of the border at .
Buffalo Creek was named for the fact a pioneer killed a <a href="American%20bison">buffalo</a> near its banks.
